relation: Lot of on campus activities. Some are fun, others can even qualify for extra credit. Look in your email and check the billboards.
Cafe is great. Staff is wonderful.
Its a commuter school, so no dorms.
It varies, depending on your class and professor. Some classes will require you to teach yourself, while others will guide you through the whole thing.
Work hard, study often. If you know what you want to major, go to the transfer office in the Technology Center in MTL to choose your classes.
Its a great school for people who are not sure about attending college. There are get transfer opportunities available to students. If you work hard you will be successful.
pageTitle: Burlington County College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Gabriella from Marlton, NJ 12/28/2011 Reviewer is A past student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 2 of 43 Categories Comments Great for these types of students if you don't know what you want to do yet with your life, go to BCC take basic classes and maybe you'll figure out what you want to do next. Tips for prospective students Try to decide where you want to go after BCC BEFORE you go there and then every semester meet with a transfer counselor to make sure your credits/ classes will transfer to your new school Bang for the buck Very cheap for great education, you'll save SO much money staying home your first two years of college, when post people don't even know what they want to do yet anyway you can just take basic classes. Did enjoy being here I know a lot of people hate BCC, but I honestly loved it. it was
